meanings.definition: A recurrent throbbing headache that typically affects one side of the head and is often accompanied by nausea and disturbed vision.
meanings.sent1: After a long day in the sun, she developed a migraine that made her head hurt badly.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't go to the party because her migraine was so severe.
meanings.sent3: The migraine decided to visit her right before her important presentation.
meanings.sent4: The migraine was like a relentless drummer pounding inside her skull.
meanings.sent5: The migraine felt like a storm brewing in her head, ready to unleash its fury.

meanings.sent1: He had to cancel his plans because he would migraine all day.
meanings.sent2: She knew she would migraine during stressful situations.
meanings.sent3: They joked that he would always migraine on Mondays, like clockwork.
meanings.sent4: The thought of having to migraine during the vacation was disappointing.
meanings.sent5: She could feel the tension building up, a sign that she would soon migraine.
